content:
Podcasts http://www2.le.ac.uk hourly 1 2006-02-14T08:00:00Z Starting University http://www2.le.ac.uk/projects/oer/oers/beyond-distance-research-alliance/bdra-podcast-starting-university UKOER podcast Abstract

Starting University will be one of the most daunting yet rewarding things that you ever do. The first few days in the new environment of your university will provide many new experiences and raise a whole range of emotional responses from excitement and anticipation to homesickness and loneliness.

In this podcast the students discuss those first few days and how they dealt with the situations in which they found themselves. They provide advice on everything from settling in on the first day to making friends and joining societies.

 

View OER

    ]]>     No publisher rjm1 2009-11-23T10:25:00Z Page     Starting Uni http://www2.le.ac.uk/projects/oer/oers/beyond-distance-research-alliance/bdra-starting-uni UKOER podcast Abstract

    Starting university can be a daunting experience. StartingUni.info podcasts are recordings of students talking about their experiences of starting university. There\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds a range of topics which new students will find useful, and although the recordings are mostly of students studying biological sciences at the University of Leicester most of what they say will apply to any course at any university.

    ]]>     No publisher rjm1 2009-11-23T10:25:00Z Page     Adapting to University http://www2.le.ac.uk/projects/oer/oers/beyond-distance-research-alliance/bdra-podcast-adapting-to-university UKOER podcast Abstract

    Life at university will be very different to life at college or school. Increased independence and personal responsibility will mean that a new level of maturity is an absolute necessity. Whether studying, working or just living, you will be in charge of your own destiny.

    In this podcast the students highlight some of the main differences between studying at college and university. They talk about the level of maturity required, having to be responsible for your own learning and making sure that you have a good understanding of your subject.

     

    View OER

    ]]>     No publisher rjm1 2009-11-23T10:25:00Z Page     Accommodation http://www2.le.ac.uk/projects/oer/oers/beyond-distance-research-alliance/bdra-podcast-accommodation UKOER podcast Abstract

    Where you are going to live is one of the most important decisions that you will make before coming to university. Whilst the vast majority of first years choose to live in halls of residence, most second and third years live in private rented accommodation, and some first years do too. In some cases, living at home is also possible.

    The University of Leicester has a number of halls of residence across the city ranging from the catered halls in the leafy Oadby Student Village, which accommodate students on thirty-week contracts, to the self-catered halls almost on the doorstep of the university, which allow forty-two or fifty-one week contracts. Given the large student population of Leicester, there is also a significant amount of affordable private accommodation available.

    In this podcast the students talk about their experiences with accommodation in Leicester. They discuss living in and adapting to halls of residence, the advantages of good private accommodation and how to find it, and the relative merits of living at home.

     

    View OER

    ]]>     No publisher rjm1 2009-11-23T10:25:00Z Page     Money Management http://www2.le.ac.uk/projects/oer/oers/beyond-distance-research-alliance/bdra-podcast-money-management UKOER podcast Abstract

    With fees, rent, books, food, clothes and any other living expenses, university can be a worrying experience financially. If you are to make the most of your time at university, managing your money must be a significant part of your life as a student. You may even need to get a job to support yourself.

    In this podcast the students give advice on how to ensure your own financial stability. Their advice covers both how to look after the money you have with careful budgeting and how to earn more money through part-time employment.
